Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay while diving with Protek”
Reviews.Author: scubaharley
Reviews.Content: I booked a Cave diving course with Protek Dive Centre who are actually in the building, they recommended I stay in Moms Hotel. It is fairly basic but certainly did the job for me, it has air con and a fan the bed was huge and the en suite had a large combined bath and shower with warm water on a regular basis. I ate at the local restaurants around the area which were all excellent and very reasonable. Unfortunately the bar was shut when I stayed, but the guys in the dive centre said it was excellent when open. There was free wifi which was good enough for Skyping home with. It was very good value for money costing around £18 a day

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, set in an average area in an expensive, over-rated town”
Reviews.Author: completely_beat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were stuck in Playa Del Carmen for a night and saw no reason to pay a lot for lodging (our main beach town destination was Tulum and we did not care for Playa AT ALL). We came across this hotel walking, checked the price and room, and felt it would do the job. The front desk woman was friendly and gave us a bit of a discount, so we stayed. The room was fine, the a/c was ok, and I think there was a bit of hot water in the morning. We enjoyed cooling off in the roof top hammock but were disappointed the pool was closed off at night (it was a very tiny, square pool but it would have been nice to sit in for a few minutes). We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well managed, friendly, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: sway7
Reviews.Content: Mom's Hotel was a very nice place to stay and reasonably priced. We have stayed there repeatedly. It is a quiet and safe hotel. The room was well maintained and very comfortable. The pub food was very good and reasonably priced. Our room had a kitchenette and it is a short walk for groceries. Good restaurants close by. Downtown is walking distance. Wireless internet available. Thanks Arturo from Sway

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, off-the-beaten-path”
Reviews.Author: mo66tel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for what we needed: a cheap, friendly place that was plain and simple. If you go on vacation to be out sightseeing, and really just need a clean bed to crash in, this is where to go. However if you have princess needs and spend all your time in the room, keep looking. It's about 6 blocks from the beach, located IN the town and not on the touristy Avenida 5. The bar/restaurant was friendly and had great food, with nice outdoor second floor balcony to sit on. Super friendly front desk. It has some urban noise, but with doors closed and a/c on, it's fine. Only drawback was the shower with VERY little water pressure. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: MEXICANEXPRESSGIRL
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers very good value for money. Buck for buck it is very good. Plus points Price!! Hard to beat. Clean rooms maintained by good maid service. Showers pretty good and spacious. Beds are comfortable also. Good security. Downside Noise. Bar is very noisy, full of bar flies who don't stay at hotel! Noise begins around 4.30 PM and ends maybe 10.00pm to 12.00pm. Scuba school starts early (part of complex) and loud Germans and metal equipment being moved and rolled on concrete makes a lot of noise maybe 7.30am to 8.45 am. Disturbs sleep every day. Rooms are too dark. German bar owner is very loud and shouts a lot.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Does Need A Good Scrub.”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveller083
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mom's Hotel for one night and changed hotel the day after. The room we had was not clean. We were on the second floor, room 14. There were dead bugs on the floor and the bathroom needed a good clean up. We got there late at night so we stayed for the night and looked for another place the following morning. I have seen some rooms on the top floor (studios) which seemed better.

Reviews.Title: “Ask to see your room first”
Reviews.Author: playa4ever
Reviews.Content: Mom's hotel is appealing enough from the street view but the rooms are very dark and dank. Our room was located on the first floor of the three story hotel and no natural light came in at all. The handful of rooms that face the courtyard may be better but the whole hotel was in need of a serious scrub down. The first day we were there a huge palmetto bug- aka cockroach- walked into the room. We live in FL and see them around also but it was not that comforting to see it right next to your luggage on vacation. The view out of our "window" was of shelves of scuba diving equipment. The window was basically a screen with some type of plastic window covering. The beds were not comfortable and the sheets and bedding material need a serious update. My kids slept on their beach towels for the two long nights we tried to sleep there. The positive things about the property are definitely the bar/restaurant with the nice german man Yodon managing the place and doing some awesome cooking and the beautifal and personable Paloma bar tending. The bar has a pool table, dart board and a nice view of the busy corner of calle 4 and avenida 30. You can also go up to the rooftop and see a good view of the city. We paid holiday prices of $75 usd a night and the place was definitely not worth that. There were several long term renters staying in apartments there that are probably much more appealing due to their size and location in the property. I would definitely ask to see your room first before deciding to stay here. We went closer into the beach area and found a nice, bright, CLEAN place to stay for 10 dollars more a night.

Reviews.Title: “Value value value!!”
Reviews.Author: BEACHESANDTHINGS
Reviews.Content: What impressed me was the atmosphere, more than anything. Maybe I was lucky with respect to who was staying here and that factor has left me with a wonderful memory of my time here. This place is very good value and the rooms and facilities in general are pretty good for the money. I slept well and felt safe staying here. Also, I encountered no cockroaches in my room, which can be a problem in Mexico. The only slight downside is the walk to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Budget heaven”
Reviews.Author: platapelo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mom's several times, most recently in October '05. It was wonderful, a great deal for the price. The rooms are clean and functional, location great (3 blocks from the beach), the pool small but clean, but best of all is the staff. I've travelled and lived in old Mexico for many years and the staff are the friendliest and most accomodating I've encountered to date. For those looking to stay in a budget hotel with above average amenities, this is the place. Orale!

Reviews.Title: “Planning to return to Mom's”
Reviews.Author: kardog
Reviews.Content: Just returned on 3 Feb from ten days at Mom's. A quaint Mexican hotel. You get what you pay for and rooms at this hotel cost well below other hotels in the area. Beds were comfortable, sheets and towels clean every day. Our air conditioner had some questionable wiring, but since we only needed the ceiling fan we didn't use it. The lobby and courtyard have places to sit and visit with others staying there if you choose.There is a pretty pool for cooling off, but it's not large enough to swim laps. Everything you need is within walking distance (including a Walmart three blocks away). The sewage smell comes and goes, the shower worked fine, and I liked the atmosphere. It certainly is not a typical American style hotel. My only complaint was the early morning traffic noise which is very loud if you don't have the room closed up with the air conditioner on.

Reviews.Title: “stinky bed and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: lmw26
Reviews.Content: Mom´s sounded like an inviting place, but it was one of the most disappointing experiences I´ve had at a hotel. The beds smelled like mold. I think they tried to cover the smell with harsh cleaners, which almost made it worse. The bathroom also smelled like sewage. The room was damp and the air conditioner was loud and didn´t work very well. We went down the street and found another hotel for less money that was sparkling clean and cheerful. I would not recommend Mom´s for mid-budget range - it was a rip off for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Murray185
Reviews.Content: We stayed a month at Mom's Xmas/New Years 03/04 had a wonderful experience. (Picked Mom's from the internet) Trying to find time to go again. The longer term residents were great with helpful hints on how to get arround and see the sights without spending a lot. The mix of short term hotel guests from arround the world added to the experience. The Lobby was the morning coffee stop to touch base with other guests and compare the previous days adventures and plan your own new adventure for the day. Mom's is adequatly clean and comfortable but don't expect 5 star luxury. The staff are eager to help however possible. Give Mom's a serious look.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Moms Hotel Is by far the most friendly place I have ever stayed, and I travel all over the world. The rooms are great, the staff is like family. I have been to Moms many times and I will be leaving soon on my fourth trip to Moms this year. If you dont want to go home.... Go to Moms...its better than home,

Reviews.Title: “Good & Cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mom's is a mere 5 minute walk or 4 blocks to the beach and the heart of Playa del Carmen. It has a restaurant/bar on a patio on the second floor terrace, open to the air. Drinks aren't expensive, and you're bound to meet some extrememly interesting people frequenting and staying there. A room will cost you $25-40US per night depending on vacancy and the season. There's a small plunge pool in the courtyard, many of the rooms are air conditioned, and generally it's a very reasonably priced place to stay, within stumbling distance to the beach and 5th Ave. **plus is probably how I'd rate it, but it's great for those on a budget!
